Posts.EditableText: I saw in some old blog post that there were plans to make a version of Quest for Mac and Linux. Is this still in development?
Posts.HTML: I saw in some old blog post that there were plans to make a version of Quest for Mac and Linux. Is this still in development?

Posts.EditableText:
Hello.

There is a new version of Quest in development.

https://github.com/ThePix/QuestJS
Posts.HTML:
Hello.

There is a new version of Quest in development.

https://github.com/ThePix/QuestJS

Posts.EditableText: I have only an apple I pad and would welcome the new update to quest . I have written several games, but have no coding knowledge at all ( unless you count Sinclair basic) . I am far too old to learn coding now. I am worried that Quest 6 will be beyond me . Will I be able to continue as I do now?
Posts.HTML: I have only an apple I pad and would welcome the new update to quest . I have written several games, but have no coding knowledge at all ( unless you count Sinclair basic) . I am far too old to learn coding now. I am worried that Quest 6 will be beyond me . Will I be able to continue as I do now?

Posts.EditableText:
>  I am far too old to learn coding now. I am worried that Quest 6 will be beyond me . Will I be able to continue as I do now?

I am 99.999% sure everyone who can use Quest 5 to write games will be able to easily use Quest 6 to write games.  There may be a few things to get used to, like maybe clicking on different things to do stuff once in a while or something like that, but it shouldn't require any more coding knowledge than is required for Quest 5.
